question: Which country's political history was connected to the "Greater Wrath Period"?
explanation: Finland's political history was connected to the Greater Wrath Period which is spanned from 1700 to 1721. This period, in Finland, during the Great Northern War, Finland was dominated by the Russian invasion and subsequent military occupation of Finland, then part of Sweden, from 1741 until the Treaty of Nystad 1721, which ended the Great Northern War.
